reason:
CRITICAL REFERENCE MISATTRIBUTION: The cited references (Taylor-Woodward 2005, Costantino 2007, Belletti-Yang 2025) do NOT prove results for fixed real q > 0, q != 1 with spins j -> infinity.

(1) TAYLOR-WOODWARD (Selecta Math 2005, math/0305113): The main theorems (Sections 4-7) prove 6j asymptotics for q a PRIMITIVE ROOT OF UNITY, relating to SPHERICAL tetrahedra. The hyperbolic case (q real positive) is discussed in Section 9 but the results are STATED WITHOUT PROOF. Therefore citing Taylor-Woodward as establishing |{6j}_q| ~ exp(j * Vol_hyp(q)) for real q is misleading - it is an unproven conjecture in that paper.

(2) COSTANTINO (Geom Topol 2007, math/0611399): Works at q = e^{pi*sqrt(-1)/r}, a ROOT OF UNITY, with spins and r growing together proportionally. Not fixed real q.

(3) BELLETTI-YANG (J Topology 2025, 2308.13864): Works under Turaev-Viro admissibility conditions, meaning q = e^{2*pi*i/r} ROOT OF UNITY with spins bounded by (r-2)/2. Asymptotic limit is r -> infinity with spins proportional to r. NOT fixed real q.

ALL THREE references work in root-of-unity regimes. For fixed real q > 0 with spins -> infinity, the asymptotics are an open question. The node conflates two qualitatively different mathematical regimes.
